Author: darrensayang
Content:
Hello there, thanks Hato for the insights! I do have a follow up, though:
1. Does the opposition system require us to have a parliamentary system as a prerequisite?
2. Why do you say that the 4th Sila opposes the opposition idea?

Author: istirahato
Content:
1. Actually it is not necessary whether we implement parliamentary system or not. We can see US presidential system (but they have complex bureaucracy to having a "working-opposite"/"check-balance").
2. Because on Sila 4 is stated that we are running democracy with "Musyawarah Mufakat". Also if we are reading the *official translation* of that, we are allowed to having a opposition ONLY if we have a *good-helpful criticism* (something that always has been indoctrinate since ORBA). To make it worse, those *official translation* are derived from the ORBA itself (P4).

Author: istirahato
Content:
Furthermore, i don't think we can be an opposition that easily in these days (as a party in the parliament), because 
1. The price to running the decent party is astronomical
2. if we have an ideology-based party (either right or left, liberals or conservative or religion based), they must comply to Pancasila as *Asas Tunggal* on their AD/ART.
3. Our bureaucracy is crippling (corrupt law-maker and law-enforcement)
